Description: Rim sherd of Clazomenian pottery amphora; interior glazed black with two bands in added red and near bottom of sherd a third; reserved below; exterior: black on rounded rim; on neck decoration consisting of part of large black silhouette palmette; inscription on interior.
Curator's comments: Object owned and held by the Ashmolean Museum, Oxford. This record is included in the British Museum database as part of the Museum’s Naukratis Project, a research collaboration that aims to virtually re-unite finds from the ancient port city of Naukratis, now distributed over 80 museums worldwide.
For a parallel regarding the decoration, see Oxford AN1925.608d(2). The silhouette palmette is typically found on the neck of Urla Group amphorai.
Bibliographic references: Cook 1952 / A List of Clazomenian Pottery (p. 132, no. 35)
Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GH.116) (phase 3)
Previous owner: Currently owned by: Ashmolean Museum, University of Oxford
